name: Fogie Arcade Repair
description:
Fogie Arcade Repair is a puzzle game where the player must adjust valves with no instructions, figure out what they do and get the protagonist to the other side. You repair an art deco-styled Mario Bros-like game and playtest it.

WASD to move around.
Look with the Mouse.
Space to hit the Jump button on  the arcade cabinet.
Mouse wheel to adjust the valves.

Fogie Arcade Repair started its life as a VR game for Global Game Jam 2020 but the programmer couldn't get a VR headset the first day of it so it was scrapped and made into an First Person puzzle game. I was the main artist who created most of the assets, I was also the game designer before the programmer redid everything I made because he had hard coded the room 's layout in his version of the game. Making our gits incompatible.

Basically I did the 3D modeling, and came up with the initial core concept but the content was scrapped by the programmer. The changes that were made don't make reflect my design choices.  Such as the giant toolbox in the corner (which was originally a normal one on a table).

You can see the original room was much more spacious and less claustrophobic.


Basically I'm still salty about it because I was super proud of my game design and it was basically stripped away without my consultation. 

Environmental art by me.
Programming and level design by Adam Hahn.
Valves and Lightbulbs by Aaron Cloet.
